channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rodrigo Duterte Is Expected to Again Become Mayor of Davao City
item.description: Former President Rodrigo Duterte, who faces international court charges of crimes against humanity, remains very popular at home.

item.title: Why Patients Are Being Forced to Switch to a 2nd-Choice Obesity Drug
item.description: CVS Caremark decided to stop offering Zepbound in favor of Wegovy for weight loss. It’s the latest example of limits imposed by insurance that disrupt...

item.title: Dow futures and the dollar surge as Wall Street cheers U.S.-China tariff talks
item.description: The U.S.-China tariff negotiations appeared to yield "a broad framework under which the two nations can conduct further talks," an analyst said.

item.title: Trump Is Poised to Accept a Luxury 747 From Qatar for Use as Air Force One
item.description: The plan raises substantial ethical issues, given the immense value of the lavishly appointed plane and that Mr. Trump intends to take ownership of it...

item.title: Trump Plan Would Tie Some Drug Prices to What Peer Nations Pay
item.description: The president announced an executive order aimed at lowering U.S. drug costs, revisiting an idea that was blocked in court during his first term.

item.title: ‘Size does not matter’: Bhutan’s tiny sovereign wealth fund banks on green energy and Bitcoin
item.description: Bhutan wants to be known for more than just spiritual tourism and Himalayan mountains.

item.title: Trump seeks to match US drug costs with cheaper ones abroad
item.description: He said in a social media post that pharmaceutical prices could drop 30% to 80%.

item.title: Asia Stocks Rise on Hope for Lower Tariffs After U.S.-China Talks
item.description: Investors were optimistic after American officials touted progress in trade negotiations over the weekend, though details had yet to be released.

item.title: Hamas Says It Will Release Its Last American Hostage
item.description: The announcement, which did not say when the hostage, Edan Alexander, would be set free, came as President Trump planned to visit the region.

item.title: Rodrigo Duterte Is Expected to Again Become Mayor of Davao City
item.description: Former President Rodrigo Duterte, who faces international court charges of crimes against humanity, remains very popular at home.

item.title: Toyota faces biggest hit from Trump tariffs among auto companies
item.description: While Toyota has increased US production to more than half of sales in the country, it still relies on imports of key vehicle parts and models.

item.title: Musk says testing gold card visa program in ‘quiet trial’
item.description: The “gold card” program is a Trump plan that would give wealthy foreigners who can pay for it an easier path to citizenship.

item.title: As Cease-Fire Seems to Hold, India and Pakistan Both Claim Victory
item.description: The Trump administration’s public descriptions of its role in the mediation seemed to touch some sensitive spots politically in India.

item.title: Zelensky Demands Cease-Fire in Response to Putin’s Call for Direct Talks
item.description: The Ukrainian president claimed he was ready to travel to Turkey to meet with Russia’s leader, but he also insisted on an immediate truce before negot...
